content: Good God. The Canadian Forces just suffered one of their single biggest losses for one incident today on the Afghanistan front: "Four Canadian Soldiers KIA" article link of military.com And Australia suffered similar losses this week, as discussed the following threads: "Second Digger KIA this week in Afghanistan, Mar.19, 2009" thread of military.com "Another Digger KIA in Afghanistan, Mar.16, 2009" thread of military.com RIP Soldiers.
reply: Good God. title: Multiple Canadian and Aussie Soldiers KIA in Afghanistan

content: In Flanders Fields By: Lieutenant Colonel John McCrae, MD (1872-1918) Canadian Army In Flanders Fields the poppies blow Between the crosses row on row, That mark our place; and in the sky The larks, still bravely singing, fly Scarce heard amid the guns below. We are the Dead. Short days ago We lived, felt dawn, saw sunset glow, Loved and were loved, and now we lie In Flanders fields. Take up our quarrel with the foe: To you from failing hands we throw The torch; be yours to hold it high. If ye break faith with us who die We shall not sleep, though poppies grow In Flanders fields. Hearing Canadian dead reminded me of this.

content: quote: Originally posted by GeraldM: In Flanders Fields By: Lieutenant Colonel John McCrae, MD (1872-1918) Canadian Army In Flanders Fields the poppies blow Between the crosses row on row, That mark our place; and in the sky The larks, still bravely singing, fly Scarce heard amid the guns below. We are the Dead. Short days ago We lived, felt dawn, saw sunset glow, Loved and were loved, and now we lie In Flanders fields. Take up our quarrel with the foe: To you from failing hands we throw The torch; be yours to hold it high. If ye break faith with us who die We shall not sleep, though poppies grow In Flanders fields. Hearing Canadian dead reminded me of this. You might find this interesting: "http://www.arlingtoncemetery.net/flanders.htm" But with all respect to the dead of WWI, this is a better cause. My condolances to the families of those who died in Afghanistan. I firmly believe that the issue is ultimately that of civilisation vs barbarism. Mistakes have already been made - nevertheless, I believe this is the question. Dave
